dipy.core.track_learning¶

Learning algorithms for tractography

Functions¶

dipy.core.track_learning.bundle_from_refs(brain, braind, refs, divergence_threshold=0.29999999999999999, fibre_weight=0.69999999999999996, far_thresh=25, zhang_thresh=15, end_thresh=10)¶
dipy.core.track_learning.detect_corpus_callosum(tracks, plane=91, ysize=217, zsize=181, width=1.0, use_atlas=0, use_preselected_tracks=0, ball_radius=5)¶
Detect corpus callosum in a mni registered dataset of shape (181,217,181)
dipy.core.track_learning.detect_corresponding_tracks(indices, tracks1, tracks2)¶
Detect corresponding tracks from 1 to 2
dipy.core.track_learning.detect_corresponding_tracks_extended(indices, tracks1, indices2, tracks2)¶
Detect corresponding tracks from 1 to 2
dipy.core.track_learning.emi_atlas()¶
Eleftherios-Matthew-Ian Atlas version 0.00001 Our atlas is based on Brain1 Scan1 from the PBC competition and the ICBM DTI-81 Atlas where ref are indices of tracks selected or given by distance metrics and value is the corresponding value for the bundle that this track belongs in the ICBM atlas.
dipy.core.track_learning.local_skeleton_clustering(tracks, d_thr=10)¶
deprecated use same funciton in performance
dipy.core.track_learning.max_concentration(plane_hits, ref)¶
calculates the log determinant of the concentration matrix for the hits in planehits
dipy.core.track_learning.missing_tracks(indices1, indices2)¶
Missing tracks in bundle1 but not bundle2
dipy.core.track_learning.near_clusters(c, C1, C2, n=1)¶
Return ‘n’ closest clusters in C2 from cluster C1[c] using the hidden track
dipy.core.track_learning.neck_finder(hitdata, ref)¶
To identify regions of concentration of fibres related by hitdata to a reference fibre
dipy.core.track_learning.refconc(brain, ref, divergence_threshold=0.29999999999999999, fibre_weight=0.69999999999999996)¶
given a reference fibre locates the parallel fibres in brain (tracks) with threshold_hitdata applied to cut_planes output then follows with concentration to locate the locus of a neck
dipy.core.track_learning.relabel_by_atlas_value_and_zhang(atlas_tracks, atlas, tes, tracks, tracksd, zhang_thr)¶
dipy.core.track_learning.rm_far_ends(ref, tracks, dist=25)¶

rm tracks with far endpoints Parameters: —————- ref: array, shape (N,3)

xyz points of the reference track
tracks: sequence
of tracks as arrays, shape (N1,3) .. (Nm,3)
dist: float
endpoint distance threshold
dipy.core.track_learning.rm_far_tracks(ref, tracks, dist=25, down=False)¶
Remove tracks which are far away using as a distance metric the average euclidean distance of the following three points start point, midpoint and end point.
dipy.core.track_learning.skeletal_tracks(tracks, rand_selected=1000, ball_radius=5, neighb_no=50)¶
Filter out unnescessary tracks and keep only a few good ones. Aka the balls along a track method.
dipy.core.track_learning.threshold_hitdata(hitdata, divergence_threshold=0.25, fibre_weight=0.80000000000000004)¶
[1] Removes hits in hitdata which have divergence above threshold.
[2] Removes fibres in hitdata whose fraction of remaining hits is below
the required weight.
dipy.core.track_learning.track_indices_for_a_value_in_atlas(atlas, value, tes, tracks)¶
